metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, PHP, Python, Bootstrap, Java and XML.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: C Arrays
Arrays
Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable, instead of declaring separate variables for each value.
content.html: Arrays are used to store multiple values in a single variable, instead of declaring separate variables for each value.

content.text: To create an array, define the data type (like int ) and specify the name of the array followed by square brackets [] .
content.html: To create an array, define the data type (like int) and specify the name of the array followed by square brackets [].

content.text: To insert values to it, use a comma-separated list inside curly braces, and make sure all values are of the same data type:
content.html: To insert values to it, use a comma-separated list inside curly braces, and make sure all values are of the same data type:

content.code_html: int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};

content.text: We have now created a variable that holds an array of four integers.
content.html: We have now created a variable that holds an array of four integers.

content.text: Access the Elements of an Array
To access an array element, refer to its index number .
content.html: To access an array element, refer to its index number.

content.text: Array indexes start with 0 : [0] is the first element. [1] is the second element, etc.
content.html: Array indexes start with 0: [0] is the first element. [1] is the second element, etc.

content.text: This statement accesses the value of the first element [0] in myNumbers :
content.html: This statement accesses the value of the first element [0] in myNumbers:

content.code_html:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};
printf("%d", myNumbers[0]);

// Outputs 25

content.text: Change an Array Element
To change the value of a specific element, refer to the index number:
content.html: To change the value of a specific element, refer to the index number:

content.code_html: myNumbers[0] = 33;

int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};
myNumbers[0] = 33;

printf("%d", myNumbers[0]);

// Now outputs 33 instead of 25

content.text: Loop Through an Array
You can loop through the array elements with the for loop.
content.html: You can loop through the array elements with the for loop.

content.text: The following example outputs all elements in the myNumbers array:
content.html: The following example outputs all elements in the myNumbers array:

syntaxHighlighting.text:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};int i;for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) 
  {  printf("%d\n", myNumbers[i]);}

content.code:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};int i;for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
{  printf("%d\n", myNumbers[i]);}

syntax_highlighting.text:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};int i;for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) 
  {  printf("%d\n", myNumbers[i]);}

content.code_html:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};
int i;

for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
  printf("%d\n", myNumbers[i]);
}

syntax_highlighting_data.text:
int myNumbers[] = {25, 50, 75, 100};int i;for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) 
  {  printf("%d\n", myNumbers[i]);}

content.text: Set Array Size
Another common way to create arrays, is to specify the size of the array, and add elements later:
content.html: Another common way to create arrays, is to specify the size of the array, and add elements later:

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Declare an array of four integers:

syntax_highlighting.text: // Declare an array of four integers:

content.code_html:
// Declare an array of four integers:
int myNumbers[4];

// Add elements
myNumbers[0] = 25;
myNumbers[1] = 50;
myNumbers[2] = 75;
myNumbers[3] = 100;

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Declare an array of four integers:

content.text: Using this method, you should know the number of array elements in advance, in order for the program to store enough memory.
content.html: Using this method, you should know the number of array elements in advance, in order for the program to store enough memory.

content.text: You are not able to change the size of the array after creation.
content.html: You are not able to change the size of the array after creation.

content.text: Avoid Mixing Data Types
It is important to note that all elements in an array must be of the same data type .
content.html: It is important to note that all elements in an array must be of the same data type.

content.text: This means you cannot mix different types of values, like integers and floating point numbers, in the same array:
content.html: This means you cannot mix different types of values, like integers and floating point numbers, in the same array:

content.code_html: int myArray[] = {25, 50, 75, 3.15, 5.99};

content.text: In the example above, the values 3.15 and 5.99 will be truncated to 3 and 5. In some cases it might also result in an error, so it is important to always make sure that the elements in the array are of the same type.
content.html: In the example above, the values 3.15 and 5.99 will be truncated to 3 and 5. In some cases it might also result in an error, so it is important to always make sure that the elements in the array are of the same type.

content.text: Exercise ? What is this? Test your skills by answering a few questions about the topics of this page
Of the following, what is the correct syntax to declare an array of integers called myNumbers with the values 25, 50, 75, and 100?
content.html: Of the following, what is the correct syntax to declare an array of integers called myNumbers with the values 25, 50, 75, and 100?
